content: Stocks Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 07 Mar 2019Snapchat's ($SNAP) CEO just sold 6% of his shares- 4.45million shares for over 44million. Signal to sell/short?3 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Leonard TanLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 10 Mar 2019Yes as Gabriel and Terence both said- its information that is probably already priced in! From a fundamental perspective, $SNAP has rebounded since beating analyst estimations in its previous earnings report. Although the company is still losing active users, it does not appear as bad as street forecasts. Even though many people are believers in the bear case for SNAP, SNAP is not going down without a fight from management!0 comments0

Terence Tan, Finance at Singapore Management UniversityLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 07 Mar 2019A CEO selling his share is not a good indicator.But as Gabriel stated, it is a delayed report. No point habouring over it.0 comments0

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 07 Mar 2019Not a very good indicator to long or short.Anyway when these big shareholders buy/sell and when the retailers get the news, it is already delayed.0 comments0
